H0.text: Bacterial and eukaryotic cells are the kinds of cells in which polyribosomes are found.

H1.text: Chloroplasts and nuclei are the kinds of cells where polyribosomes are found.

H2.text: Polyribosomes are found in prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells.

H3.text: Polyribosomes are found in yeast and prokaryotic cells.

A4.text: In all species, more than one ribosome may move along a single mRNA chain at one time (as a polysome), each 'reading' a specific sequence and producing a corresponding protein molecule.
